Detailed Description

This class holds named server lists.

Each list of servers contained in this class is keyed to a name and a type. Using the name and type a serverlist can be retrieved.

bool NamedServerLists::addServerList (  const MC2String &  name,
const MC2String &  type,
const MC2String &  serverlist
) 
 

Adds a new server list, unless the name - type pair is already present.

Parameters:
name The name of the new list.
type The type of the new list.
serverlist The new list.
Returns:
True if the list was added, false if the name - type pair was already present.

const MC2String& NamedServerLists::findServerList (  const MC2String &  name,
const MC2String &  type
)  const
 

Finds the list associated with a name and a key.

If no list is found it returns the empty string.

Parameters:
name The name.
type The type.
Returns:
The server list or the empty string.

const char* NamedServerLists::getServerList (  const char *  name,
const char *  type
)  const
 

Fetches the list associated with a name and a key.

If no list is found it returns NULL.

Parameters:
name The name.
type The type.
Returns:
The server list or NULL.

uint32 NamedServerLists::getServerListsCRC (  const MC2String &  listName,
const MC2String &  type
)  const
 

Finds the CRC of the list associated with a name and a key.

If no list is found it returns 0.

Parameters:
name The name.
type The type.
Returns:
The CRC of the server list or 0.

Parses a serverlist line of the serverlist file.

bool NamedServerLists::parseGroup (  MC2String &  name,
const char *  data
)  [static, private]
 

Parses a "group line" of a server file.

A group line matches this regexp: '^:[ ]*\([^
]\)
', the group name is the kept part.

Parameters:
name The name of the group if the line was succesfully parsed.
data The data that should be parsed.
lineNum The line number of the data. Used for log messages.
Returns:
True if parsed, false if the parse failed.

void NamedServerLists::parseServerFile (  const char *  serverFile  ) 
 

Parses the content of an already read file and constructs the map of <name,type> -> list.

The list follows this syntax: # comment : <name> <type> <list> <type2> <list2>

Parameters:
serverFile The contents of the serverfile as one long string.

bool NamedServerLists::replaceServerList (  const MC2String &  name,
const MC2String &  type,
const MC2String &  serverlist
) 
 

Adds a new server list.

If the name - type pair is already present the new list replaces the old list.

Parameters:
name The name of the new list.
type The type of the new list.
serverlist The new list.

const MC2String NamedServerLists::m_emptyString [static, private]
 

The empty string sometimes returned by findServerList.
